title: [$250] Add Print button to reports in New Expensify (parity with Expensify Classic)

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.9-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @PedroEspinoza1999 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769216206401249) ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to Reports > Reports 2. Click on any report to view details 3. Click on the "More" button and observe ## Expected Result: Users can print reports instantly from the report view ## Actual Result: New Expensify currently does not offer a Print button directly within reports. In Expensify Classic, users can print reports immediately using a dedicated Print button, enabling much faster workflows. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Solution: Introduce a Print functionality directly within reports in New Expensify that mirrors the behavior in Expensify Classic. This would allow users to instantly print reports without first downloading files, saving time and improving the overall reporting experience. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/98eff8b7-7bf7-4a32-b469-10d6ee4b9d98 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.9-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79197 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdosjosjdoijosjosidj@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Distance rates are enabled. - Workspace has at least two different rates. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Click + > Track distance > Manual. 4. Enter amount > Next. 5. On confirm page, click Create expense. 6. Open the distance expense. 7. Click Distance and change to 0. 8. Click Rate and select another rate. ## Expected Result: Amount will be 0.00 because distance is 0. ## Actual Result: Amount changes to the value of previous distance (non-zero) when distance is 0. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/afd6f155-5393-4b71-8f2e-d10463d4b165 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.9-1
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3607/folder/13176791/41237172/1149843141
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdosjosjdoijosjosidj@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to workspace chat.
3. Create an expense.
4. Open the expense.
5. Click More > Split > Save.
6. Log in to the same account on OD.
7. On OD, open the report with split expenses.
8. On OD, open any split, change the amount to 0 and save it.
9. Return to ND and refresh the same report on ND.
10. Open the non-zero split.
11. Click Amount.
12. Click on the split row with 0.00 amount.

## Expected Result:
User should be able to edit the split when split amount is 0.00.

## Actual Result:
User is not able to edit the split when split amount is 0.00.
It shows "Approved or paid expenses cannot be edited" which is not true because the split is not approved or paid.

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Device used:** Android 13 / Xiaomi Poco F5, iOS 15.8.3 / iPhone 7 Plus
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
1. Launch the hybrid app and login using Expensifail account
2. FAB > Track Distance > GPS tab
3. Tap the Start GPS trip (allow the location permission flow if appear)
4. Wait for start address to appear
Verify that it also shows the GPS tooltip
5. Close the GPS tooltip
6. Stop the trip and log out
7. Log in again and FAB > Track Distance > GPS tab
8. Tap the Start GPS trip

## Expected Result:
Stop the trip and log out, log in again and check that after starting the trip and showing the start address there is no tooltip

## Actual Result:
GPS tooltips still appear when starting GPS after log out and login again

## Workaround:
Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.9-1
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/27754595/test-cases/77992811
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** MacBook Air 15.7.3 Chrome, iPhone 15 iOS 26.1
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Preconditions: Create an Admin and a Member, selecting "Manage my team's expenses" option

1. As Admin, invite the Member to the workspace
2. As Member, create 2 expenses in your own workspace chat, click Submit
3. As Member, open the report, click More - Change workspace - Admin's workspace
4. As Admin, navigate to the Member's workspace chat, open the expense report - there is no Approve option
5. As Admin, select one of the expenses - More menu - there is no Reject option
6. As a Member, open the workspace report - there is an Approve option, but the system message says "Waiting for Admin to approve expenses"

## Expected Result:
Approve option is displayed in the expense report for the workspace Admin after submitter changed the workspace. Reject option is available in the expense details/ More menu

## Actual Result:
For Admin: Approve button and option are not displayed, system message says "Waiting for Member to approve expenses". Reject option is not available in the expense details
For Member: Approve button is displayed, but system message says "Waiting for Admin to approve expenses".

## Workaround:
Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.8-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3390/folder/13176791/71461417/1146028714?sort=%2Bidentifier **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Windows 10 **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: 1. Go to a workspace 2. Create an expense for $200 as a submitter 3. Click on "More" and select "Split" 4. Click on the "Date" pill 5. Click on the "Split dates" 6. Set the start date as the 16th 7. Set the end date as the 18th and tap Save 8. Verify that three splits are created with equal amounts adding up to the original transaction amount Result: The split dates are created for 15, 16, and 17 instead of 16, 17, and 18. 9. Try with another day ranges Result: Split dates range shifts one day earlier from start date ## Expected Result: Three splits are created from start day to end day (16, 17, and 18), with equal amounts adding up to the original transaction amount. ## Actual Result: Split dates range shifts one day earlier from start date (15,16,17) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f6b0b8d8-82f3-4af3-a3fb-902c3a0028fd [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
